programme.title: Pirate Traders
programme.desc: Cameras follow treasure hunters the Pirates Inc on high-pressure and often dangerous missions to retrieve and sell valuable items left behind by drug traffickers. In this episode, the team heads to Belize to find a plane when the pilot is jailed.

programme.title: Storage Wars Canada
programme.desc: Bogart tries to get his father in shape in time for his wedding. Meanwhile, Roy brings a mime to an auction in Corktown.

programme.title: Storage Wars Canada
programme.desc: The buyers have high hopes for a container auction in a town named Utopia, but it remains to be seen whether they will uncover any household treasures worth celebrating.

programme.title: Swamp People
programme.desc: David and Jeremy hunt one of the swamp's most infamous gators, but time is running out for this season and the hunters are encountering some unexpected obstacles.

programme.title: Monster Croc Wrangler
programme.desc: Animal helper Matt Wright and his team take on a dangerous challenge to ensure the survival of the saltwater crocodile. They must gather more than 20,000 unhatched eggs for relocation, but the fiercely protective reptilian mothers do not take well to their territory being invaded.

programme.title: Monster Croc Wrangler
programme.desc: Australia's brumbies are widely regarded as pests and shot by choppers, so Matt Wright plans to relieve the problem by rounding up the horses and giving them a better life.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Mike Wolfe and Frank Fritz explore a warehouse belonging to country musician Mickey Gilley, and find a sign used in the movie Urban Cowboy.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Experts investigate the mysterious origins of mummification and any possible influences exerted by extraterrestrials with a superior knowledge of science and engineering.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Giorgio Tsoukalos examines the notion that extraterrestrials could have left clues to the universe's mysteries. Experts investigate cryptic puzzles that might have been placed by ancient aliens.

programme.title: World's Deadliest Weather: Caught on Camera
programme.desc: A wildfire tears across California, a mother runs from a tornado, and a rescue team tries to reach a canoeist trapped in a tree during a fatal flood.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Mike and Frank head to Minnesota and challenge Danielle to sell a fibreglass cowboy boot they bought more than a year previously.

programme.title: Irish Pickers
programme.desc: Ian and Butzy cross the Irish Sea to the north of England, where destinations include Manchester United's Old Trafford, the home of one of Ireland's sporting greats - George Best.

programme.title: Auction Hunters
programme.desc: Ton and Allen fight back when a storeowner seems intent on preventing them from scoring new items in Santa Barbara. Plus, the guys discover a vintage wooden boat.

programme.title: Auction Hunters
programme.desc: Allen Haff and Ton Jones try to raise money to fix their truck. Plus, they get their hands on a foosball table, Tommy gun drums and a hoard of Twinkies.

programme.title: Auction Hunters
programme.desc: The guys battle it out with a fierce former employee, and a set of monster truck tires and a mystery box are their last chance to come out on top.

programme.title: Auction Hunters
programme.desc: Ton and Allen face their toughest challenge yet when two old rivals join forces, and the guys find an off-road motorcycle and a pair of net guns.

programme.title: Auction Hunters
programme.desc: Ton and Big Sis revamp the shop to help bring in more customers. Plus, Allen unearths a set of antique basketballs, and goes toe-to-toe with an NBA Hall of Famer.

programme.title: Auction Hunters
programme.desc: Ton and Allen are in Nashville, Tennessee, where they meet a band of tough, high-bidding bikers before discovering a 37mm anti-tank gun and a cowboy's rodeo saddle.

programme.title: Auction Hunters
programme.desc: Big Sis reveals bad news as the guys clash with Carolyn over a carnival unit at an auction. Meanwhile, Ton and Allen unearth a Native American tomahawk.

programme.title: Auction Hunters
programme.desc: Allen Haff and Ton Jones get taken down by their fiercest opponent CJ, but a twist of fate keeps them in the game.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Darrell makes the most expensive purchase in the history of the series at an auction in Orange.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Casey and Rene buy a small, mysterious unit, and discover it contains a Wizard of Oz chess set.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Jarrod attends auctions in Mission Viejo and ends up with some unusual art on his hands. Barry's accountant tries to stop him from spending too much money.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Darrell and Ivy battle it out at a locker auction in Lancaster, California, while Jarrod and Brandi buy some DJ equipment.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: The bidders attend an auction in Placentia, California, where Rene and Casey buy a locker full of luggage. Meanwhile, Barry is left pondering his future.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Barry adopts a disguise at an auction in Stanton, while Darrell gets himself banned from bidding.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: The buyers visit Moreno Valley, where Casey and Rene acquire the perfect locker and Darrell's plans go badly wrong.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Jarrod and Brandi discover their latest purchase could be worth $25,000, while Darrell buys some video game memorabilia.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: In Compton, Mike buys something that Herb does not want to be anywhere near. Jarrod ends up with a new nickname while Barry and his old pal Kenny reunite.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.sub-title: High Noon in the High Desert
programme.desc: Barry discovers the personal possessions of rap magnate Suge Knight, while Jarrod and Dave aim to buy a classic organ.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter: Most Wanted
programme.desc: Beth loses her battle with cancer and the family says goodbye to their matriarch. Ripped apart by grief, they rebound by going out on a hunt.

programme.title: Billion Dollar Wreck
programme.desc: When a diver gets tangled in the wreck and another line compromises the propeller, Tim suits up and dives into harm's way, but Martin quarrels over the location of the gold chamber.

programme.title: Knightfall
programme.desc: After suffering a casualty, the Knights Templar prepare to exact revenge. De Nogaret faces some of his greatest challenges while Landry and Talus come to an understanding on Knightfall. Part-fictionalised drama, starring Tom Cullen, Jim Carter and Padraic Delaney.

programme.title: World's Deadliest Weather: Caught on Camera
programme.desc: A wildfire tears across California, a mother runs from a tornado, and a rescue team tries to reach a canoeist trapped in a tree during a fatal flood.

programme.title: Air Crash: Disasters Uncovered
programme.desc: A look at what happened when a notorious terrorist sets off a bomb on Philippine Airlines Flight 434, leaving one dead and 10 injured.

programme.title: Have I Got a Bit More News for You
programme.desc: Match of the Day presenter Gary Lineker takes over the reins for extended edition of the satirical quiz, with comedian Tom Allen and political commentator Ayesha Hazarika joining team captains Ian Hislop and Paul Merton to poke fun at the stories making the headlines.

programme.title: Dave Gorman: Modern Life Is Goodish
programme.desc: Dave invents a newish game show, and considers subjects from threats that are not threatening. He also examines the evolution of the Honey Monster, the shyness of elks, and the naming of insects.

programme.title: Zapped
programme.desc: Brian has been captured and forced to perform in a sinister circus, run by the cheerily sadistic Feffenhoffer, played by guest star Steve Coogan.

programme.title: Zapped
programme.desc: Brian pitches for a job in the pub while Herman helps an old warrior friend. Barbara finds herself in charge of the Munty Pet show, which Howell is attempting to fix.

programme.title: Zapped
programme.desc: Brian introduces popcorn to Munty, Barbara dreams of becoming one of the famous Munty Clack Dancers and Howell makes a truth potion for Slasher Morgan - with disastrous results.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Beat the Internet with John Robins
programme.desc: The comedian hosts as members of the public are pitted against each other in a quest to predict how search engines respond to a series of questions.

programme.title: Beat the Internet with John Robins
programme.desc: The comedian hosts as members of the public are pitted against each other in a quest to predict how search engines respond to a series of questions.

programme.title: Rick Stein's French Odyssey
programme.desc: The connoisseur of local food takes a gastronomic tour along the canal systems of southern France, from Bordeaux to Marseille. He samples seafood and regional cuisine, as well as exploring a variety of traditional recipes, including artichoke salad with poached egg, eels in cider, and bass with beurre blanc.

programme.title: Rick Stein's French Odyssey
programme.desc: The connoisseur of local food explores the banks of the River Garonne on board a 100-year-old converted barge, and savours the delights of French provincial cooking including magret de canard and petit sale. Other dishes featured are clams in white garlic sauce, eels in parsley and garlic butter, and steak tartare.

programme.title: Eddie Eats America
programme.desc: In Houston, Eddie faces the 'grim reaper' in a crawfish challenge featuring the fearsome reaper pepper. He also devours some southern comfort food and pulls a plane down a runway.

programme.title: Eddie Eats America
programme.desc: Eddie Hall follows in Rocky's footsteps with physical challenges at a famed Philadelphia boxing gym - and his very own hunger games in the infamous Philly Cheesesteak Challenge.

programme.title: Expedition with Steve Backshall
programme.desc: Steve and a team of rock climbers head to the desert of southern Oman to attempt the first ascent of a towering escarpment, hoping to discover the rare and elusive Arabian leopard.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson, Richard Hammond and James May are in Russia as the motoring magazine returns, taking part in a race across the urban landscape of St Petersburg. James defends the honour of the car in a very small Renault, Richard tries to prove that pedalling is faster by riding a bicycle, while Jeremy attempts to demonstrate that water is the quickest way across town by piloting a hovercraft. To make matters more complicated, all three presenters are racing not only one another but also the Stig, who is making his way toward the finish line by public transport. Plus, the new Lamborghini Huracan is put through its paces and singer-songwriter Ed Sheeran takes to the test track in the Reasonably Priced Car.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: The presenters embark on a road trip across Australia's Northern Territory in fast, luxurious GT cars, with Jeremy Clarkson choosing a BMW M6 Gran Coupe, Richard Hammond picking a Bentley Continental GT V8 and James May opting for a Nissan GT-R. The trio set out on an adventure that takes in crocodile-infested rivers, a race around a vast opencast mine and an encounter with one of the world's longest lorries, concluding with an unusual challenge involving a farm, their cars and 4,000 cows. Plus, 24 star Kiefer Sutherland takes to the track in the Reasonably Priced Car.

programme.title: Red Bull Soapbox Race
programme.desc: Elysian Park in Los Angeles is turned into an obstacle-littered course for the day as 70 teams of adrenaline junkies put their gravity-powered contraptions to the test.

programme.title: Red Bull Soapbox Race
programme.desc: The competing teams' motorless vehicles use gravity as their only form of propulsion in the Belgian capital of Brussels.

programme.title: Cop Car Workshop
programme.desc: Inspector Dave Corcoran calls on his friend to turn what looks like a tug boat into a police vessel. Meanwhile, the team fix up a car whose tyres were slashed whilst on duty.

programme.title: Room 101
programme.desc: Frank Skinner presents the comedy panel show, which sees chef and MasterChef judge John Torode, comedian Russell Howard and actress Katherine Parkinson compete to have their pet hates banished for ever. Their gripes include massive pepper grinders, grumpy kids and DJs who join in at the end of a song.

programme.title: Room 101
programme.desc: Frank Skinner invites comedy actress Catherine Tate, X Factor contender-turned-television host Rylan Clark-Neal and veteran actor Nigel Havers to vent their spleen about people and objects that upset them. Their gripes include hipster restaurants, set-up paparazzi shoots and Labour Party leader Jeremy Corbyn.

programme.title: Room 101
programme.desc: Frank Skinner invites comedian David Mitchell, tennis coach Judy Murray and Countryfile presenter Anita Rani to vent their spleen about people and objects that upset them. Their gripes include sniffing, walking and eating, and sugar lumps.

programme.title: Red Bull Soapbox Race
programme.desc: Coverage of the Brazil event, in which teams of amateur racers design and build their own gravity-powered soapbox vehicles and race them in an extreme downhill battle.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Paddy McGuinness, Freddie Flintoff and Chris Harris are sent on a high-altitude mountain expedition across Peru in second-hand American cars. Plus, back at the track, Chris tests out the latest electric car from Porsche.

programme.title: Expedition with Steve Backshall
programme.desc: Steve and a team of rock climbers head to the desert of southern Oman to attempt the first ascent of a towering escarpment, hoping to discover the rare and elusive Arabian leopard.

programme.title: Have I Got a Bit More News for You
programme.desc: Match of the Day presenter Gary Lineker takes over the reins for extended edition of the satirical quiz, with comedian Tom Allen and political commentator Ayesha Hazarika joining team captains Ian Hislop and Paul Merton to poke fun at the stories making the headlines.

programme.title: QI XL
programme.desc: An extended edition of the quiz show, in which question-master Stephen Fry muddles through the middle show of the middle series as comedians Jimmy Carr, Aisling Bea and Danny Bhoy compete alongside resident panellist Alan Davies. As usual, points are awarded for the answers the host finds most interesting, regardless of whether or not they are correct.

programme.title: Live at the Apollo
programme.sub-title: Ed Byrne, Angela Barnes, Geoff Norcott
programme.desc: Ed Byrne plays host in this show recorded before a packed house at London's Hammersmith Apollo. He warms up the audience and then introduces routines by Angela Barnes and Geoff Norcott.

programme.title: Mock the Week
programme.desc: Angela Barnes, Ed Byrne, Ed Gamble, Ivo Graham and Romesh Ranganathan join host Dara O Briain and regular Hugh Dennis for the topical comedy show, looking back at the week's events through the medium of fast-thinking and improvisation. First shown in September 2016.

programme.title: Have I Got a Bit More News for You
programme.desc: Comedian and actress Jo Brand takes over the reins for an extended edition of the satirical quiz, with Independent Group MP Heidi Allen and stand-up Phil Wang joining team captains Ian Hislop and Paul Merton to poke fun at the stories making the headlines.

programme.title: Impossible Engineering
programme.desc: Constructing the Gotthard Base Tunnel in Switzerland, the longest rail tunnel in the world, running for 57 kilometres through the Alps.

programme.title: Coast
programme.desc: Neil Oliver admires ginger seals at Walton-on-the-Naze, while Nick Crane examines the area's fossil record. Miranda Krestovnikoff explores research into the thornback ray on the Thames Estuary and how it aids conservation. The team also visits Felixstowe, the UK's busiest container port, where HM Revenue and Customs uncover a stash of cocaine smuggled among furniture.

programme.title: Deadliest Crash: Disaster at Le Mans
programme.desc: Documentary examining what caused Pierre Levegh's Mercedes to crash into the crowd during the 1955 Le Mans 24-hour race, killing more than 80 people - an accident that remains the worst in the history of motor racing. Among the theories discussed are the use of untested technologies by the car's manufacturers, the addition of a lethal fuel additive and allegations of reckless driving by future Formula One world champion Mike Hawthorn, who won the race with Jaguar team partner Ivor Bueb. Narrated by Jack Deam.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: SAS: Rogue Warriors
programme.desc: Ben Macintyre uses the SAS archives to examine the history of the British Army special forces unit combining documents, unseen footage and interviews with its founding members to tell the remarkable story behind an extraordinary fighting force. In the first edition, he looks at its formation in the heat of the north African desert in 1941, when eccentric young British army officer David Archibald Stirling had a vision for a new kind of war in which the enemy was attacked from behind their own lines.

programme.title: SAS: Rogue Warriors
programme.desc: Ben Macintyre examines how continued success for the unit could only be achieved with ever more dangerous and ambitious missions, while David Stirling's new second-in-command Captain Paddy Mayne was an officer as unpredictable and dangerous as the phase of war that was about to begin. The historian also reveals how many SAS members were captured by the Germans - and hears the extraordinary story of two of them who outran their pursuers by surviving for three days in the desert without food or fresh water.

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: British bombers are unable to hit their targets precisely and attack German cities under cover of darkness, while the Blitz in Britain brings public demand for revenge strikes, and Arthur Harris takes charge of Bomber Command.

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: Churchill's plan to attack Germany through Italy. Although considered the simplest military solution, the Allies were to face formidable opposition, while the Americans met the Wehrmacht for the first time. Narrated by Laurence Olivier.

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: The longest retreat in British military history, when Allied troops defending Burma in 1942 were confronted by Japanese forces well prepared for jungle warfare. Narrated by Laurence Olivier.

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: The Luftwaffe's bombing raids on Britain's provincial cities, when Coventry and Plymouth were hardest hit, although Portsmouth, Glasgow, Sheffield and Bristol also suffered heavy casualties. Narrated by Laurence Olivier.

programme.title: The World at War
programme.desc: How the morale of the Third Reich, boosted by Germany's initial military successes, was shattered by the devastating defeat at Stalingrad, relentless Allied bombing raids and an attempt on Hitler's life. Narrated by Laurence Olivier.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: The desert town that faced a disaster of biblical proportions. Plus, scorched remains that speak of imprisonment and torture and vast coastal ruins that reveal a past once wiped from history.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: The underground base with the power to destroy a nation, the site linked with an attempt to kill a vicious dictator, and an ancient world discovered in the open American wilderness.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: Claustrophobic prison cells that contain a story worthy of international acclaim, and a vast mountainside complex that held the power to change the world.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: A secretive underground base that concealed the power to destroy nations, and a sprawling industrial relic clinging to the edge of an unforgiving waterfall.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: A marooned ironclad structure off the coast of England that hides a dramatic story of war and resilience, and a facility in the heart of America that helped tear apart a nation.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: Forgotten relics from the defence of America's homeland, concealed by the banks of the Mississippi, and a concrete behemoth on the French coast that proved invulnerable to attacks.

programme.title: Saluting Dad's Army
programme.desc: Alexander Armstrong goes behind the scenes to discover just how Dad's Army was made and meets locals from the Norfolk town of Thetford, which stood in for Walmington-on-Sea. Plus, he hears from the expert professionals who brought Jimmy Perry and David Croft's ambitious ideas to the screen.

programme.title: 'Allo 'Allo!
programme.desc: British troops save Edith and Rene from execution, and the pair are released into the woods. Meanwhile, the Germans decide to head for Spain, and Michelle joins Crabtree in a duet. Classic wartime sitcom, starring Gorden Kaye and Carmen Silvera.

programme.title: 'Allo 'Allo!
programme.desc: First episode of the Second World War comedy set in German-occupied France about the misadventures of womanising cafe owner Rene Artois, whose cafe is commandeered by the Resistance to shelter two airmen. Starring Gorden Kaye, Carmen Silvera and Vicki Michelle.

programme.title: 'Allo 'Allo!
programme.desc: Herr Flick is in the village trying to trace a valuable painting, so Rene and the Colonel decide to smuggle it out with the two British airmen who are disguised unconvincingly as Germans.

programme.title: dinnerladies
programme.desc: Norman the breadman fails to deliver, the stripper cannot play the accordion and Jean has bridesmaids' knickers on her mind. First episode of the canteen comedy, starring Victoria Wood, Julie Walters and Celia Imrie.

programme.title: dinnerladies
programme.desc: The staff await an important royal visit, but first Stan has to pick just the right toupee, and Bren is determined to get the tables cleared away in time. Comedy, starring Victoria Wood and Thelma Barlow.

programme.title: dinnerladies
programme.desc: Bren's mother wreaks havoc in the factory and incurs Stan's wrath by pursuing an ill-considered romance, while Anita organises a heated debate on the workers' current situation. Comedy, with Victoria Wood and Julie Walters.

programme.title: WW2 - Battles for Europe
programme.desc: Examining the work of the American forces who launched a huge offensive to blast a gap in the German lines and break through to liberate France.

programme.title: Kavanagh QC
programme.desc: A family GP is accused of murdering his wife, and Kavanagh, back in chambers following compassionate leave, is assigned to his defence. As the trial progresses, the battling barrister gradually comes to realise just how much he has in common with his client. Also starring Tom Courtenay, Oliver Ford Davies, Nicholas Jones and Valerie Edmond.

programme.title: Trial & Retribution
programme.desc: Part one of two. Walker is assigned to investigate the discovery of a young woman's skeleton, found underneath the patio of what used to be a boarding house, but is paired with Pat's ex-boyfriend Jeff. Drama from Widows creator Lynda LaPlante, starring David Hayman and Paul Kynman.

programme.title: Doctor Finlay
programme.desc: Dr Napier is intrigued by an ex-colonial couple recently returned from India who settle in Tannochbrae and refuse to have contact with their mysterious daughter. Starring David Rintoul, Ian Bannen and Annette Crosbie.

programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: ITV Nightscreen
programme.desc: Text-based information service.

programme.title: Babushka
programme.desc: Game show in which contestants answer questions to get the chance to open a set of giant Russian nesting dolls, with some empty and others containing prizes up to 10,000. Rylan Clark-Neal asks the questions.

programme.title: ITV Nightscreen
programme.desc: Text-based information service.

programme.title: Super 4
programme.desc: Animated comedy adventure series featuring a gang of heroes who protect the city of Technopolis and its King Kenric against evil elements.

programme.title: Super 4
programme.desc: Animated comedy adventure series featuring a gang of heroes who protect the city of Technopolis and its King Kenric against evil elements.

programme.title: Robozuna
programme.desc: Children's sci-fi fantasy series about 14-year-old orphan Ariston and his robot Mangle, fighting an evil empire together.

programme.title: Mr Magoo
programme.desc: While helping Linda clean her attic, Magoo gets shrunken and teleported into Fizz's brain. Time for a spring clean..

programme.title: Mr Magoo
programme.desc: Magoo takes Fizz for a toy containing top secret information, which he steals from a secret agent, but it's actually just weasel..

programme.title: Mr Magoo
programme.desc: Fizz and Weasel plan to enter Fizz's new condiment in a culinary contest. Magoo mistakes them for members of his band ready for a reunion..

programme.title: Mighty Mike
programme.desc: The book that Mike is reading on Vampires is scarier than he bargained for.

programme.title: Mighty Mike
programme.desc: Mike has his work cut out for him when Stephan leaves a beautiful gift for his wife on the counter and goes to work for the day.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: The buffoon declares war when he finds a fly in his room, and searches for ever more outlandish weapons. With the voice of Rowan Atkinson.

programme.title: Mr Bean: The Animated Series
programme.desc: The hapless bumbler is chased home by an angry mime artist. Voiced by Rowan Atkinson.

programme.title: Ben 10
programme.desc: While visiting China, Ben, Gwen, and Grandpa Max take a trek to the Great Wall.

programme.title: The Epic Tales of Captain Underpants
programme.sub-title: Captain Underpants and the Terrifying Perilous Misfortune of the TP Mummy
programme.desc: George and Harold are banned from buying toilet paper to stop them pulling a huge prank..

programme.title: The Rubbish World of Dave Spud
programme.desc: George finds a computer called Val but Val has a mind of her own. Soon she's set about uploading embarrassing videos to social media..

programme.title: The Rubbish World of Dave Spud
programme.desc: Fuzzypeg eats the Spuds' fish supper and Dave has to catch another. Things look up when he hooks something, but it turns out to be a whale.

programme.title: James Martin's Islands to Highlands
programme.desc: James is joined by fellow chef Tony Singh for a tour of the Isle of Skye. Tony begins by visiting a local bakery that doubles as an art gallery. He also learns how to make the local oatcakes. James, meanwhile, is inspired by the seafood to cook a dish using plaice and lovage. The duo then take a boat trip, where they go dolphin spotting, and James cooks up a fresh lobster and langoustine dish with an added Scottish twist.

programme.title: Ainsley's Mediterranean Cookbook
programme.desc: Ainsley Harriott's culinary tour reaches Seville in southern Spain, starting at a convent where the nuns sell home-made sweets to visitors - a tradition that goes back 400 years. He also learns about iberico ham from deli owner Elio, and hooks up with local cookery teacher Ana to learn a few traditional recipes, before tour guide Lola takes him for a boating at the Plaza De Espana. Along the way, he rustles up a charred orange and spiced almond salad, a Spanish pork sandwich and a tapas selection.

programme.title: John and Lisa's Weekend Kitchen
programme.desc: John Torode and Lisa Faulkner demonstrate recipes for duck pancakes with a homemade plum sauce, egg fried rice, Goan fish skewers, and lime and passionfruit pie.

programme.title: Love Your Garden
programme.desc: Alan Titchmarsh and his team head to Shrewsbury in Shropshire to meet former nurse Gina Constable, who has raised over a quarter of a million pounds for the Air Ambulance charity over the past 21 years. Inspired by the wishes of her late husband, the team set to work transforming her garden into a breathtaking Japanese-inspired outdoor space, complete with cloud-pruned trees and Japanese maples.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Barnaby's former CID colleague Jack Colby left the force under a cloud following a sex scandal involving villagers and officers at Causton police station. Now retrained as a probation officer, Jack is working at a halfway house for reformed criminals, so when he is bludgeoned to death the detective sets out to discover why the past would not leave him alone. With Chris Barrie, Edward Petherbridge, Sue Jenkins, Nigel Harrison and Christopher Fairbank.

programme.title: Britain's Got Talent
programme.desc: Ant and Dec host the 14th series of nationwide talent search, which sees a wide variety of acts, from comedians to contortionists, singers to spoon players, compete for the chance to win 250,000 and a coveted slot at the Royal Variety Performance. Simon Cowell, Amanda Holden, Alesha Dixon and David Walliams are once again on hand to judge this week's applicants, and each of them has the chance to put their favourite contestant straight through to the live semi-finals by awarding them the Golden Buzzer.

programme.title: Tenable
programme.desc: Quiz hosted by Warwick Davis in which a team of five friends answers questions about top 10 lists from the realms of pop culture and general knowledge, then tries to score a perfect 10 in the final round to take home the prize money.

programme.title: Tipping Point: Lucky Stars
programme.desc: Ben Shephard invites Strictly Come Dancing head judge Shirley Ballas, Mrs Brown's Boys star Danny O'Carroll and Corrie's Andy Whyment to take part in a special edition of the quiz show, in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the better their chances of collecting the 20,000 prize for their selected charity.

programme.title: The Family Chase
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents the game show in which four relatives team up - this week the Clementsons from Newcastle - and pit their wits against one of the finest quiz brains in the country, in the hope of taking away thousands of pounds.

programme.title: Van Der Valk
programme.desc: A young woman is murdered in the vicinity of a library and museum owned by a wealthy philanthropist with an interest in global mysticism. It's a complicated investigation, which leads the detectives into a world of mysticism, erotica, drug addiction and tempestuous family dynamics. But as if the case were not enough to contend with, Van der Valk also finds himself fending off office gossip about himself and his newly single colleague Lucienne. Marc Warren stars as the shrewd Dutch detective, with Maimie McCoy and Luke Allen-Gale.

programme.title: Absolutely India: Mancs in Mumbai
programme.desc: Brothers Ryan, Adam and Scott Thomas trace their family roots in India, joined by their dad Dougie, whose father was born in Mumbai. However, the trio have never visited the country they descended from. In the opening episode, the siblings arrive in India and have an extremely fiery introduction to the local cuisine. They also give the kids at their grandad's old school a crash course in how to talk like true Mancs, and make a major discovery about the relatives their grandad left behind.

programme.title: Ross Kemp: On the NHS Frontline
programme.desc: Ross returns to Milton Keynes Hospital Trust as frontline medical staff brace themselves for the peak of the coronavirus pandemic. With greater numbers of patients testing positive for Covid-19, Kemp witnesses new wards opening to accommodate them and speaks to staff working around the clock to save lives. He also speaks to patients who have come to the hospital with coronavirus symptoms - some will go home and recuperate quickly, but others may have a long road to recovery ahead of them.

programme.title: Killer Women with Piers Morgan
programme.desc: Journalist and broadcaster Piers Morgan travels across the USA to meet some of America's most notorious female killers in a quest to discover what drives women to kill. He travels to Gatesville, Texas, to visit Erin Caffey, who masterminded the murder of her entire family at the age of 16, and will remain behind bars until she is almost 60. Piers finds out what made a typical teenager conspire with her boyfriend to kill her mum, dad, and two younger brothers, before meeting the only survivor of the tragedy, Erin's father Terry.

programme.desc: Text-based information service.

programme.title: Biggest Dance Hits Of The 10s
programme.desc: The 2010's have been a decade of great hits including some absolutely huge dance tracks - turn that volume all the way up.

programme.title: The Vamps' Biggest Hits Of The 10s
programme.desc: Brad, Tristan, Connor and James present their favourite hits of the decade, and chat about their tour mates and collaborators like McFly, Taylor Swift, Selena Gomez and Little Mix.

programme.title: All The Hits, All Night
programme.desc: Non-stop hits to see you all the way through the night.

programme.title: Jungle Gold
programme.desc: As severe flooding, problems with equipment and hostile locals threaten the mining operation, Scott and George hope new mechanic Travis can help them to get back on track.

programme.title: Secrets of the Underground
programme.desc: Rob Nelson investigates mysterious tunnels under Denver's airport, then heads to Ohio to uncover the secrets of a giant serpent-shaped mound.

programme.title: American Chopper
programme.desc: Mikey and Paul Jr head to Louisiana to consult with Red Jacket Firearms on a custom gun design, while Paul Sr attempts to reconcile with his sons.

programme.title: World's Top 5
programme.desc: An exploration of factories on a mammoth scale, including Nasa's vast vehicle assembly building and Europe's largest food processing plant.

programme.title: Dirty Jobs
programme.desc: Mike samples life as a medical waste processor, learning what medical waste is and then doing his bit to treat it. Along the way, his new colleagues have some surprises in store.

programme.title: How It's Made
programme.desc: The documentary exploring manufacturing processes concludes with a look at how dragster tyres, icing, floating docks and spiral pipes are made.

programme.title: How It's Made
programme.sub-title: Rubber Gloves/Soap Carvings/Aircraft Cabinets/Motorcycle Brake Locks
programme.desc: The manufacture of objects such as rubber gloves and aircraft cabinets, and how processes have developed over the years.

programme.title: Robson Green's Australian Adventure
programme.desc: The actor explores some of the most remote locations in Australia's biggest state, hoping to gain an understanding of how people live and work isolated from the rest of the country.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Mike Wolfe and Frank Fritz continue to hunt down objects with historical, collectable and pop culture value that have been long forgotten by their owners. In the heart of Texas, a family's vintage service station is just like a petroliana museum where the awesome inventory is all off-limits.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters: Classic Cars
programme.desc: Drew Pritchard and Paul Cowland leap at the chance to buy a rare pickup version of a mini, but the decision about what to do with the tatty canvas load cover causes some creative differences.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Salesman Mike Brewer and mechanic Ant Anstead take on a 1987 Alfa Romeo Spider Quadrifoglio with a rare hard-top. The car needs extensive repairs, including a rebuild of the propshaft.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer goes to France in search of a retro Citroen HY Van, but mechanic Edd China is not impressed with his spoils, knowing it will be a costly renovation.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Drew Pritchard browses a salvage fair by Ripley Castle, North Yorkshire. In Newcastle, he visits a dealer of mid-20th century designer furniture and later checks out an art collection in Hastings, East Sussex.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters: The Restorers
programme.desc: The artisan restorers behind Drew Pritchard's antiques empire save an iconic Eames lounge chair. They also revive an unusual 90-year old oil lamp and a glamourous steam trunk.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters: The Restorers
programme.desc: Drew Pritchard's artisan restorers rescue a ravaged carousel horse dating from before the First World War. Plus, they revive a valuable 1930s sofa and a 100-year-old weathervane.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters: The Restorers
programme.desc: The restorers face a challenge with Chesterfield sofa rescued from the scrapheap. Plus, they set out to revive a shattered marble figurine and a broken French bakery counter.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters: The Restorers
programme.desc: The restoration team transforms a shabby set of apothecary drawers, refreshes a French Victorian seat and saves a 1960s chandelier that witnessed a Beatle's wedding.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters: The Restorers
programme.desc: The artisan restorers revive a rare and valuable fairground ride, then resuscitate a Victorian park bench and a century-old gentleman's suitcase.

programme.title: Fantomworks
programme.desc: Jay brings Dan a 2012 Camaro ZL1 with poor performance and a blown supercharger. Plus, Terry brings in a high-powered restomod of a 1931 Landau Phaeton.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Mike Wolfe and Frank Fritz continue to hunt down objects with historical, collectable and pop culture value that have been long forgotten by their owners. In the heart of Texas, a family's vintage service station is just like a petroliana museum where the awesome inventory is all off-limits.

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: Jay Blades and the team tackle a badly water-damaged rosewood table, give a much-loved panda bear a makeover and restore a vintage toy steamboat.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Seeing an untapped source of rare items, Drew Pritchard tours Catalonia looking for some chic Spanish antiques. In Peralada, he is blown away by a 17th-century house full of treasures.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters: Classic Cars
programme.desc: Drew Pritchard and Paul Cowland leap at the chance to buy a rare pickup version of a mini, but the decision about what to do with the tatty canvas load cover causes some creative differences.

programme.title: Scrap Kings
programme.desc: The M4 is closed so diggers can demolish a bridge. Accidents pile up as scrapped engines in scrap vans are raced into oblivion in a final demolition derby.

programme.title: Cooper's Treasure
programme.desc: A dangerous storm threatens to shut down the operation just as Darrell and team discover gold in the remains of an old wreck.

programme.title: Legend of Croc Gold
programme.desc: Tension grow among the crew after a rash move by Farley leaves him broken and bedridden, and morale sinks even lower via equipment failure, and a beached boat.

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: How, after the 1993 World Trade Center bombing, DNA was traced to the bomber through the saliva that remained on the back of a mailing label.

programme.title: Murder on CCTV
programme.desc: How, when a teenager went missing, detectives struggled for leads. When surveillance cameras revealed her kidnapping, the case became a race to bring her home alive.

programme.title: Murder Comes to Town
programme.desc: The September 2011 murders of Roy Napier, his estranged wife Angela, their two adult children and neighbour Henry Smith. Gunman David Ison had earlier argued with Napier over his decision to add $2 to the price of prescription pills he was selling.

programme.title: FBI Files
programme.desc: A cult member betrays the leader to the FBI following the discovery of a decapitated young male, and is able to link him with dozens of other murders.

programme.title: Animal Cops Houston
programme.desc: Animal Cruelty Investigators arrive at a property to rescue some horses, but have a surprise in store when they discover a litter of puppies trapped inside a storm drain.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: Chris Brown helps a cuckoo with an injured leg, rescues two dogs from a rooftop, examines a golden retriever, and checks a koala's eyesight.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: Chris Brown treats a racehorse to see if it can join the unwanted thoroughbred programme. Plus, a dog hit by a car, and a kitten with earache receive attention.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Jackie, who has worn many bridal gowns throughout her modelling career, tries to find the perfect dress for her big day, while Alia returns for her final fitting.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Bridesmaids
programme.desc: Cassie tries to build bridges between her two best friends, who have hated each other since the day they met.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Bridesmaids
programme.desc: Amber and Ajeshia struggle to reach a compromise on the necklines of their bridesmaid dresses.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: Blacky the cat suffers cruel injuries, a blind dog is in dire straits, Pam the kid forms a maternal relationship with Liesl and Chris becomes a midwife.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: A woman takes her puppy for a check-up and discovers it needs major heart surgery. Following the work of Sydney veterinary surgeon Dr Chris Brown.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: Dr Chris Brown tries to save two baby Tasmanian devils that are close to death following a mysterious illness, and a miniature schnauzer when it is attacked by a puffer fish.

programme.title: My 600lb Life
programme.desc: Part one of two. Destinee never felt like she fit in, as she was born Matthew. She has come out as a transgender woman, but needs to lose some of her 600 pound-weight, so she can fully transition.

programme.title: My 600lb Life
programme.desc: Part two of two. Destinee never felt like she fit in, as she was born Matthew. She has come out as a transgender woman, but needs to lose some of her 600 pound-weight, so she can fully transition.

programme.title: My 600lb Life: Where Are They Now?
programme.desc: Melissa deals with an unplanned pregnancy, and Ashley seeks new inspiration when her weight loss grinds to a halt.

programme.title: My 600lb Life: Where Are They Now?
programme.desc: A woman tries to lose enough weight to qualify for skin removal surgery, while a patient at a Beverly Hills clinic finds her treatment tougher than expected.

programme.title: Disappeared
programme.desc: The case of Bobby and Sherilyn Jamison, who vanished along with their six-year-old daughter Madison in Oklahoma in October 2009. Detectives eventually uncovered a series of disconnected leads pointing to drugs, family dysfunction, and even supernatural beliefs.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Lindsay looks forward to a fresh start after enduring many personal tragedies, while Cher brings along her new family to help find the perfect dress.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: The grooms take over the salon and the consultants know that when 'the man' is in the salon, he is the one who could be driving the appointment. All of which guarantees them an interesting shift.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Davone arrives with high expectations, former cheerleader Carrie seeks the right dress, having returned a previous purchase, and military bride Jennifer has her first fitting.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Bride-to-be Christy wants a dress that will cover a scar and brings along her twin brothers to help choose, while Cathy arrives with her best men.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Jennifer is on the search for a new gown after being pressured into purchasing a dress by her mother and stepmother. Elsewhere, Lisa uses her fiance as a style guide.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Bride-to-be Jessica has fallen head-over-heels for a dress outside of her budget, but will she be willing to compromise?.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Susan's family travels from New York to see her dress, while Suzanne brings along her soon-to-be mother-in-law, who she is meeting for the third time.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Bride-to-be Jennifer clashes with her mother over the dress budget, while Kate has a crisis involving a curved band of fabric.

programme.title: Long Island Medium
programme.desc: Theresa Caputo visits a winery to reconnect with her friends, but the mood is ruined when a sceptic attends.

programme.title: Long Island Medium
programme.desc: Theresa Caputo helps a woman seeking closure, while her children decide to upgrade the cassette player in her car.

programme.title: Long Island Medium
programme.desc: Theresa Caputo tries to help a woman connect with her late father, but it seems her commitments to clients and the spiritual world may be taking a toll on her family life.

programme.title: Long Island Medium
programme.desc: Theresa Caputo answers questions and offers an insight into how her gift works. Plus, she reveals her thoughts on sceptics.

programme.title: Hoarding: Buried Alive
programme.desc: A woman's reluctance to throw rubbish away leaves her home a germ-infested health hazard.

programme.title: Born to Kill?
programme.desc: Psychologists and criminology experts analyse the personalities of some of the world's most infamous murderers, beginning with serial killer Fred West, who was charged with 12 murders in 1994 after police discovered the remains of nine bodies at his home in Gloucester. Though he committed suicide before he could be tried for the crimes, his wife Rosemary was convicted of killing 10 women and girls in November 1995.

programme.title: 1000lb Sisters
programme.desc: After a stressful first month of dieting, the sisters head back to Atlanta for a check in with Dr Procter. The results force Amy to make a difficult decision.

programme.title: Dr G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: The doctor tries to piece together the evidence that will determine exactly what happened when a 43-year-old man took a nap at his parents' house, and was later found dead in bed. Plus, a 53-year-old woman found dead on her sofa.

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: How tiny shreds of evidence can be crucial in proving the guilt or innocence of suspects, focusing on the murders committed by David Middleton and the killings of Bunchee Nyhuis and Jeffrey Russell.
